Generation I.Red: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Pok é Ball , they have zapped many people.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Pok é Ball , they have zapped many people.
Generation I.Yellow: It is said to camouflage itself as a Pok é Ball . It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
Generation I.Stadium: Usually found in power plants. In some instances, they have been seen drawing power from the trolleys of electric trains.

Generation II.Gold: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
Generation II.Silver: It was discovered when Pok é Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.
Generation II.Crystal: During the study of this Pok é mon , it was discovered that its components are not found in nature.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It was discovered when Pok é Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Pok é Balls . The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pok é mon looks very similar to a Pok é Ball remains a mystery.
Generation III.Sapphire: Voltorb is extremely sensitive - it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Pok é Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
Generation III.Emerald: It bears an uncanny and unexplained resemblance to a Pok é Ball . Because it explodes at the slightest shock, even veteran Trainers treat it with caution.
Generation III.FireRed: A life-form whose identity is unknown. It is said to Screech or suddenly SelfDestruct .
Generation III.LeafGreen: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Pok é Ball , it has zapped many people.

Generation IV.Diamond: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
